actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 1 of H. Res. 1230. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on December 22, 2022.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1529, H. Res. 1434 is considered passed House.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1529, H. Res. 693 is considered passed House.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 397
actions-list.actionItem: 12 (Roll no. 538).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 3308 — "To authorize the Colorado River Indian Tribes to enter into lease or exchange agreements and storage agreements relating to water of the Colorado River allocated to the Colorado River Indian Tribes, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 378
actions-list.actionItem: 33 (Roll no. 537).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 3168 — "To amend the White Mountain Apache Tribe Water Rights Quantification Act of 2010 to modify the enforceability date for certain provisions, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion that the House suspend the rules and Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays (2/3 required): (Roll no. Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 393
actions-list.actionItem: 19 (Roll no. 536).
Considered as unfinished business.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 393
actions-list.actionItem: 19 (Roll no. 535).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 2834 — "To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to preserve access to rehabilitation innovation centers under the Medicare program."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 385
actions-list.actionItem: 28 (Roll no. 534).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 4926 — "To amend chapter 33 of title 28, United States Code, to require appropriate use of multidisciplinary teams for investigations of child sexual exploitation or abuse, the production of child sexual abuse material, or child trafficking conducted by the Federal Bureau of Investigation."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 394
actions-list.actionItem: 19 (Roll no. 533).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 5168 — "To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to include aliens passing in transit through the United States to board a vessel on which the alien will perform ship-to-ship liquid cargo transfer operations within a class of nonimmigrant aliens, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 350
actions-list.actionItem: 59 (Roll no. 532).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 2333 — "To amend chapter 2205 of title 36, United States Code, to ensure equal treatment of athletes, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 216

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 1529 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 9640) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for examination and disclosure with respect to Presidential income tax returns; providing for consideration of the bill (S. 1942) to standardize the designation of National Heritage Areas, and for other purposes; and for other purposes."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was on motions to suspend the rules and on agreeing to H. Res. 1529, which were debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.

actions-list.header: PRINTING OF PROCEEDINGS IN THE RECORD
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Hoyer asked unanimous consent that the proceedings had during the recess be printed in the record. Agreed to without objection.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 21.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The Speaker announced that the Joint Meeting was dissolved. The House remains in recess subject to the Call of the Chair.
The House convened in Joint Meeting with the Senate to receive an address by His Excellency Volodymyr Zelenskyy, President of Ukraine.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 21.

The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The House will reconvene in Joint Meeting with the Senate for the purpose of receiving His Excellency Volodymyr Zelenskyy, President of Ukraine. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 1529, the Chair put the question on adoption of the resolution and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mrs. Fischbach demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1529.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1529 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 9640) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for examination and disclosure with respect to Presidential income tax returns; providing for consideration of the bill (S. 1942) to standardize the designation of National Heritage Areas, and for other purposes; and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on the motion to suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment to H.R. 7939.
Mr. Takano moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 5016.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Takano moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 5016 — "To designate the medical center of the Department of Veterans Affairs located in Anchorage, Alaska, as the "Colonel Mary Louise Rasmuson Campus of the Alaska VA Healthcare System", and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 5329.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Peltola moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 5329 — "To amend the Bill Emerson Good Samaritan Food Donation Act to improve the program, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1402.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Peltola moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 1402 — "To amend the Native American Languages Act to ensure the survival and continuing vitality of Native American languages, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 989.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Peltola moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 989 — "To establish a Native American language resource center in furtherance of the policy set forth in the Native American Languages Act."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 5087.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Peltola moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 5087 — "To amend the Not Invisible Act of 2019 to extend, and provide additional support for, the activities of the Department of the Interior and the Department of Justice Joint Commission on Reducing Violent Crime Against Indians, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 5066.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Peltola moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 5066 — "To designate Mount Young in the State of Alaska, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 4104.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Peltola moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 4104 — "To approve the settlement of water rights claims of the Hualapai Tribe and certain allottees in the State of Arizona, to authorize construction of a water project relating to those water rights claims, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3773.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Peltola moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3773 — "To authorize the leases of up to 99 years for land held in trust for the Confederated Tribes of the Chehalis Reservation."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3308.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Peltola moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3308 — "To authorize the Colorado River Indian Tribes to enter into lease or exchange agreements and storage agreements relating to water of the Colorado River allocated to the Colorado River Indian Tribes, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3168.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Peltola moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3168 — "To amend the White Mountain Apache Tribe Water Rights Quantification Act of 2010 to modify the enforceability date for certain provisions, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on the motion to suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment to H.R. 1917.
Mr. Malinowski moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2834.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Davis, Danny K. moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 2834 — "To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to preserve access to rehabilitation innovation centers under the Medicare program."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 4411.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Maloney, Carolyn B. moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 4411 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 5302 Galveston Road in Houston, Texas, as the "Vanessa Guillen Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 450.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Ms. Waters moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 450 — "To award posthumously the Congressional Gold Medal to Emmett Till and Mamie Till-Mobley."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 4926.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Nadler moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 4926 — "To amend chapter 33 of title 28, United States Code, to require appropriate use of multidisciplinary teams for investigations of child sexual exploitation or abuse, the production of child sexual abuse material, or child trafficking conducted by the Federal Bureau of Investigation."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 5168.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Nadler moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 5168 — "To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to include aliens passing in transit through the United States to board a vessel on which the alien will perform ship-to-ship liquid cargo transfer operations within a class of nonimmigrant aliens, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2333.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Nadler moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 2333 — "To amend chapter 2205 of title 36, United States Code, to ensure equal treatment of athletes, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.

Pursuant to section 732(a) of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act (Public Law 116-113, and the order of the House of January 4, 2021, the Speaker appointed Mr. Rudy Ernesto Gonzalez, Oakland, California.

actions-list.header: Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Museum of Asian Pacific American History and Culture
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 2(b)(2) of the Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Museum of Asian Pacific American History and Culture Act (Public Law 117-140), and the order of the House of January 4, 2021, the Speaker appointed Dr. Jay Jie Xu, San Francisco, California and Mr. Dennis Cheng, New York, New York.

Pursuant to section 803(a) of the Congressional Recognition for Excellence in Arts Education Act (2 U.S.C. 803 (a)), and the order of the House of January 4, 2021, the Speaker appointed Mrs. Cheri Bustos, Galena, Illinois.

The House received a communication from The Honorable Chris Stewart. Pursuant to Rule VIII of the Rules of the House of Representatives, Representative Stewart notified the House that he had been served with a subpoena for documents issued by the Third Judicial District Court, Salt Lake County, State of Utah and that after consultation with the Office of General Counsel, he determined that compliance would be consistent with the privileges and rights of the House.

The House received a message from the Clerk Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk received a message from the Secretary of the Senate on December 20, 2022, at 3:58 p.m. stating that that body had agreed to the House amendment to S. 1466; passed S. 365; S. 989; S. 1402; S. 3168; S. 3308; S. 3388; S. 4104; S. 4411; S. 4719; S. 4949; S. 4978; S. 5087; passed without amendment H.R. 203; H.R. 441; H.R. 478; H.R. 785; H.R. 1095; H.R. 2472; H.R. 2473; H.R. 4622; H.R. 4881; H.R. 4899; H.R. 5271; H.R. 5349; H.R. 5650; H.R. 5659; H.R. 5794; H.R. 5865; H.R. 5900; H.R. 5952; H.R. 6042; H.R. 6064; H.R. 6080; H.R. 6218; H.R. 6220; H.R. 6221; H.R. 6267; H.R. 6386; H.R. 6427; H.R. 6604; H.R. 6630; H.R. 6917; H.R. 6961; H.R. 7514; H.R. 7518; H.R. 7519; H.R. 7638; H.R. 773; H.R. 8025; H.R. 8026; H.R. 8203; H.R.                8226; H.R. 8260; and H.R. 9308.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Rosa L. DeLauro to act as Speaker pro tempore to sign enrolled bills and joint resolutions through the remainder of the One Hundred and Seventeenth Congress.

Ms. Sherrill asked unanimous consent that it may be in order at any time today, for the Speaker to declare a recess, subject to the call of the Chair, for the purpose of receiving in joint meeting His Excellency Volodymyr Zelenskyy, President of Ukraine.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 21.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for  2:00 P.M. today.
The House resumed Morning-Hour Debate.

The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 1294, S. 1324, S. 1942, S. 3519, S. 3773, S. 3946, S. 3949, S. 4120, S. 4240, S. 4859, S. 5323, S. 5328, S. 5329, H.R. 3285, H.R. 5961, H.R. 7299, H.R. 7335, and H.R. 7939.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Gwen Moore to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
